bioghist.p: Francis Whittier Pennell was born in 1886 on a farm near Wawa, Delaware County, Pennsylvania. He was educated at Westtown School and the University of Pennsylvania, receiving a bachelor's degree in 1911 and a Ph.D. in 1913. From 1914 to 1921 he was associate curator of the New York Botanical Garden, and in 1928, became Curator of Plants at the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia. He was an international authority on members of the Scrophulariaceae (snapdragon family). He died in 1952.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of three postcards from Francis Pennell to George W. Bassett at the Academy between 1925 and 1927. discussing collecting trips, and specimens being sent back to the Academy. Postcards were sent from Peru, North Carolina, and Kentucky. the collection also contains a typed and handwritten manuscript of species and location descriptions for plants of the family Scrophulariaceae, including: Scrophularia, Cordylanthus, Castilleja, Mimulus, Collinsia, and Adenostegia.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
